intro: Myriocarpa brachystachys, commonly known as the short-stemmed myriocarpa, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Myriocarpa brachystachys is also valued for its hardy nature and potential use in traditional medicine.
